author: dapplion
content:
To clarify, the constants here will be part of the config and thus configurable at runtime? https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/11a037fd9227e29ee809c9397b09f8cc3383a8c0/specs/eip4844/p2p-interface.md#configuration
If not I think they should, specially `MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_BLOBS_SIDECARS_REQUESTS` is a critical parameter that should be customizable per network

author: ralexstokes
content:
i think this is the key bit from the spec:

> After EIP4844_FORK_EPOCH, BeaconBlocksByRootV2 is replaced by BeaconBlockAndBlobsSidecarByRootV1 clients MUST support requesting blocks by root for pre-fork-epoch blocks.

author: ralexstokes
content:
hmm ok it looks like we are keeping `BeaconBlocksByRootV2`  and then imo this statement is confusing

<@363800010518822915> what did you have in mind here? can we reword this bit i quoted? or just remove it?

author: terencechain
content: I think we can remove it but clients do want to support blocks by root request for pre 4844 fork blocks. Not sure where is the best place to explicitly state that

author: ralexstokes
content: i was thinking we would add a `context` value so that `BeaconBlockAndBlobsSidecarByRootV1` would *also* provide pre-4844 data

author: ralexstokes
content: otherwise we should just have both and then i think we should remove that quoted stmt

author: terencechain
content: Either option sounds great to me. I don't have a strong preference. Do you have a preference?
